snippet: It’s fine for Nepal to pursue ties with China, but the harsh treatment of Tibetan residents and refugees should not be part of that policy.
abstract: Editorial laments report finding that Nepal, long a way station for Tibetan refugees from China, has effectively become a partner in China's anti-Tibetan policies; calls on nation to reform its policies toward Tibetan residents and refugees when it drafts its new constitution in coming year.
lead_paragraph: It’s fine for Nepal to pursue ties with China, but the harsh treatment of Tibetan residents and refugees should not be part of that policy.
